website_summaries.verdict: Quality stainless steel cookie cutters with dual sides for added versatility. A combination of flat and fluted edges cover all the essential baking and cooking bases.
pros: Sharp enough to cut cleanly through almost any consistency and texture
6 different sizes accommodate a variety of baking and cooking endeavors
Double sided design requires half the storage space
cons: 2 cutting sides require careful handling when pushing down
Some users felt they could be a bit sturdier

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: These are great to use for cutting out fondant circles, and I'm sure they would work great for sugar cookies too. I used some of the smaller circles for my PS4 controller cake that I made. I love that these come all neatly in a little tin and they are easy to wipe down or wash. These are also MUCH better than using plastic cutters. These will last a long time. @sugarmumma.cakesbyjen
customer_reviews.author: Jen Ambrosio

customer_reviews.title: fine, but is the lid sticker really necessary?
customer_reviews.text: I like the container, and the sizes, and they look pretty sturdy and have a nice sharp cutting edge. But.... Why, oh why, does every product have to come with a sticker that is nearly impossible to remove? Took me several minutes of peeling and scrubbing to move the sticker on the top of the can, resulting in an abraded surface. Can you REALLY not use a sticker that will peel off easily, OR put the sticker on the plastic wrapper? Come on manufacturers! Have a heart!
customer_reviews.author: D Cazadora

customer_reviews.title: and cut countless other things for fun shapes that encourage him to eat
customer_reviews.text: I use these ALL the time! I remember putting off buying these because I wasn't sure how often I'd use them. I use them for presentation and plating, but mainly cutting. I core my toddler's apple with the smallest one, and cut countless other things for fun shapes that encourage him to eat. Toast, sandwiches, potatoes, etc. Super easy to clean too, and they don't take up any space at all. Sharp, and they cut well.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Cornstach will save these from rust!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic cutters. I love the 11-piece set because there is so much flexibility, whether you're making biscuits, cookies, raviolis, or whatever. And for $15, that's quite a bargain. Far, far, far better than buying some cheap 4-piece set at Target that will bend and end up misshapen. The big concern with these cutters, however, is rust. They need to be dried well. However, if you put a bit of cornstarch in the bottom of the tin, these WILL NOT RUST! Guaranteed. Just wipe them off before using. Wash and dry normally, but don't stress about whether or not there's a still a drop of water on them. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Good variety, sharp edges
customer_reviews.text: I needed some basic cutters for my shape-challenged cookies. Rustic is fine but sometimes you just want to bake a ROUND cookie! These cutters did a fine job on my sugar cookie dough but the edges were relatively tough on my hands. The metal is thin and, as such, a bit sharp. If I had to make the purchase over again, I'd pay more for a more for a set less likely to give me tetanus when/if they rust.
customer_reviews.author: TexasToastTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Slightly Chinsey, but otherwise great.
customer_reviews.text: They work great, I’ve been wanting good cutters after trying to find a cup or Pyrex the right size for the last four years. However, they do seem a little chinsey. I’m not letting my children play with them, and just being careful so they don’t bend. With those precautions, I think they’ll last just fine. The large is perfect for sandwich buns and the med-large is perfect for dinner rolls. Those are the only ones I’ve used so far. I find no need for an elaborate 12 piece set when a couple sizes are all that’s needed for most jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They worked
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised about how small this was, although it is exactly as described. My granddaughter had me get this so she could make mini cakes using one size to cut the mini cakes out of a regular cake and then using a smaller size to cut smaller holes in the mini cakes for candy surprises. It was fun and we will do it again. Easy cleanup and nice tin box to hold all the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, not round!
customer_reviews.text: The set we received is not professional quality and the circles are not round. Normally these should last 20 years of heavy use - I doubt these would last even one use. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: La Portuguesa

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of cutters for polymer clay
customer_reviews.text: I use these round cutters on polymer clay and they work great. I mostly use the smaller sizes, but it is nice to have such a complete set of 11 different sizes so if future work needs something bigger I will have it on hand. It is nice to have the metal tin to store them in as well. They are formed with the rim at the top so it is a little easier to push down and cut through whatever you are using it on.
customer_reviews.author: Ladyartist

customer_reviews.title: These are the best round cutters
customer_reviews.text: These are the best round cutters! They work beautifully with cookie dough, bread dough and even playdough when my grandson is here. They clean up beautifully in the dishwasher and would definitely recommend these. I even had to order a set for my sister because she used mine and loved them! And the different sizes are the best!
customer_reviews.author: Amy O.

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: A nice set of quality cutters that won't rust or bend out of shape too easily compared to some flimsy tin cutters. Convenient to have the double sides of plain and fluted, especially if you are trying to save space. My only minor issue is that I wish the fluted sides were more pronounced. After I decorate the cookies, it's difficult to tell the shapes are actually fluted. It shows up more like a subtle wave. I will be searching for cutters with more pronounced ripples.
customer_reviews.author: IcePrincess

customer_reviews.title: Love this set of round cutters
customer_reviews.text: I loved these ..I use them to cut clay for my pottery art ...love the plain and fluted sides ...great depth to them ..Easy to wash ..to make sure they don't rust I have them in a pot that has a sprinkling of corn flour in the bottom ...Super fast shipping ...very happy
customer_reviews.author: Gsygirl

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Welds are not good. Multiple rings don’t line up and few are not connected at all.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: I can work with it
customer_reviews.text: Although the product was shrink wrapped, there was a leafy green dried not the outside of the largest one? Also some of the sizes weren’t perfectly circular mainly at the seam, but should be able to bend into shape.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren B

customer_reviews.title: The original and best cutters
customer_reviews.text: Love how Ateco packages these multiple sized cutters in a tin. Especially useful for cookies, biscuits and scone recipes where you can vary the size by an 1/8th or a 1/4 of an inch. As long as you are careful about making sure the cutter is completely dry before putting away, they shouldn’t rust or discolor.
customer_reviews.author: lc

customer_reviews.title: they are ok
customer_reviews.text: These are OK. They're a little flimsier than I expected them to be but they're pretty inexpensive so I guess that's to be expected. A small (and kind of stupid) thing, but the box does not look like it does in the picture. When I was choosing cutters, I actually chose this specific one because I thought the box was really cute, so that was a bit of a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Youlia K Tzenova

customer_reviews.title: Perfect - no frills, no handles, stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: They are exactly as you see them, and work perfectly. Stainless steel, so they're easy to clean. 1.75" deep, so you're cutting everything from rolled biscuits to cake layers with ease. No handles, so you're not wasting storage space. Ideal for someone who just wants to make English muffins, or biscuits, or cakes, or whatever, without worry.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: It is fine
customer_reviews.text: A decent set at a fair price that I use for biscuit (and would use for cookies). Feels well-made. It does the job and I haven't had any issues with it. One star removed because it is used too rarely to give a more thorough, time-tested review.
customer_reviews.author: EricJM

customer_reviews.title: Great cutters
customer_reviews.text: I've used these cutters for biscuits and they worked great. I've used them on donuts as well I believe. These are easy to use and easy to clean. They make the perfect size biscuit.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: the top of the cutter is "rolled" providing a nice smooth area for handling
customer_reviews.text: I used this set, (at least I used one of the cutters), when I made baking powder biscuits the other night. As with the other cutters in this set, the top of the cutter is "rolled" providing a nice smooth area for handling. The cutting edge is nice and thin and delivers a very clean cut. I had been using a drinking class for this job but never again. These cutters come in a circular protective tin and stow in a very compact package. Very nice. I think they are very much worth the cost, and I'm well satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TonyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: It's good for burgers
customer_reviews.text: Sturdier than I thought they'd be. I use them for hamburgers. Slider size, grilled paddy size 3.5 and pub/steakhouse big boy 4.5. I like to smash my burgers, but it's nice to switch things up once in awhile.
customer_reviews.author: CallMeCaptnC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 'Round' cutter set. The product is a well made, quality product. The bands are welded together to form the circle, but the weld point is barely noticeable (you have to look for it) The cutting end seems sharp, but it is not sharpened. The corner is what you feel that might feel sharp though. It's a nice product and comes in a nice metal container.
customer_reviews.author: W. C. Greer

customer_reviews.title: Cutting biscuits & cookies has never been so much fun or ergonomic (I have carpal tunnel syndrome & have ...
customer_reviews.text: Cutting biscuits & cookies has never been so much fun or ergonomic (I have carpal tunnel syndrome & have to be careful)--even on days when I have to use something other than my palm to press them down. The other reviews are 'spot-on' because these do need to be kept dry in between uses. Silica packets or cornstarch in the container are great, workable ideas. I love the sturdiness & long-lasting-ness of the metal.
customer_reviews.author: EnduringBrightness

customer_reviews.title: Best cookies ever!
customer_reviews.text: I am not saying these cookie cutters made all the difference in my cookie making skills, but after I started using them to get the correct sizes for the cookie aesthetic I wanted, my cookies were never better! The cutters are sturdy and easy to wash. they have not rusted yet and have made it through the dishwasher several times. I love that they come in a tin that keeps them organizes and is not bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette L

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I like having the many sizes. They cut well and work much better than the can or plastic cutters I've used in the past. I'm really glad I purchased these.
customer_reviews.author: Susan P.

customer_reviews.title: Versatile cookie cutter set used in many ways in the kitchen and craft projects
customer_reviews.text: This set of cookie cutters are sturdy and work well on any job like making hamburger patties, doughnuts, cookies, mini cakes and anything. Great set and versatile if you need straight or fluted edges around on what you are making. The set comes in a plastic thin box container, so you may want to buy a sturdy container for these cookie cutter set. These are great.
customer_reviews.author: EPICurean M.Top Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Works for me. Stands up to strong use. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Very happy!
customer_reviews.text: I love the various sizes...one for just about any recipe. Can't wait to make giant biscuits. They can also be used for polymer clay.
customer_reviews.author: Sherry D

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: Good no-frills product. They are quite sturdy. I especially like that I can do so many things with them, from empanadas to pot stickers (I can't find the round goyza wrappers for sale anymore, just the square won-ton wrappers) to cookies. I make my own killer gingersnaps and they will be prettier with the ruffled edge. I plan to use the smallest smooth cutter inside the ruffled largest one to make decorated "wreath" Christmas sugar cookies for the tree.
customer_reviews.author: V. Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Rusted quickly, avoid
customer_reviews.text: These rusted immediately after I initially cleaned them. I gave them ample drying time too. Now they are basically unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Used as expected
customer_reviews.text: It is just metal circles. They are good if you need to cut dough or cookies. I am very satisfied with them
customer_reviews.author: Poizoni

customer_reviews.title: Need a metal container to hold the cutters!
customer_reviews.text: I needed the 4.5” size and got this set. However, I wish it came with a metal container with a cover instead of the plastic container it comes with. I have purchased other Ateco cutters in other sizes and they always came with the metal containers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for trimming my sandwich maker breads
customer_reviews.text: I bought the whole set because one of them is perfect for trimming bread products to exactly fit my breakfast sandwich maker. Tried to sharpen it a bit with some success. It's a little hard to use because these cut on both sides but it sure is nice for the bagle/thin bread to fit exactly in my sandwich maker.
customer_reviews.author: A. Dezutter

customer_reviews.title: Great for cookies
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these last minute prime one-day shipping and was very happy with my purchase. I used them for lemon shortbread cookies, nice size variety!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Not any sizes I could use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the set because it was so cheap, but was only looking for one size. However, NONE of the sizes were of use. Biscuits are usually the size of a glass, dipped in flour.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey S. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Ateco 11-Piece Plain Edge Round Biscuit Cutter Set
customer_reviews.text: A great compact set of round plain edge biscuit cutter set. The price is reasonable for the quality which is adequate for a home cook that uses them periodically and not daily. The variety of sizes allows me to make different sized biscuits, scones and doughnuts simply. The top of the cutter has a safety edge and the bottom edge is sharp enough to cut through different types of dough without difficulty. You can also use the cutters as a food mold. I plan on getting the square and diamond sets as well as having all these sets allows me to cook creatively.
customer_reviews.author: JulianeTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, simple
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, simple, effective. with just the rolled edge, I wouldn't use them on anything you have to push too hard but cake, biscuits, pasta(fresh), and bread haven't been a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Versatile set
customer_reviews.text: Great set. These are sturdy and the two cutting sides adds great value. A great range in sizes too.
customer_reviews.author: S. Crane

customer_reviews.title: It's a quite limited tool.
customer_reviews.text: It's might be ok to cut cookies, but not good as forming rings for patties or crabcakes.
customer_reviews.author: Far

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cookies, Biscuits, Sandwiches
customer_reviews.text: We've made tea sandwiches with smaller circle, PB&J with the larger. Biscuit and cookie dough cut nice and easy. I like the size assortment very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. Easy to use. Easy to clean. Exactly what it was described to be.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Makes perfectly shaped biscuits!
customer_reviews.text: Making biscuits like my mother in law has been turned up a notch with these. Long gone are the days of oval shaped biscuits.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Galvan

customer_reviews.title: Cookie/ Donut Cutters
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean, simple and they work. They have held up so far and appear durable. Also try the ateco cookie spatula. I store the cookie cutters in a ziploc sandwich bag.
customer_reviews.author: VitaTTop Contributor: Sunglasses

customer_reviews.title: Great round cutter set
customer_reviews.text: These are a great set of stainless steel round cutters. Everything from donut holes and biscuits to large donuts and cookies. Comes in a nice case too! Sturdy enough and I have not had any trouble with them rusting, I just make sure they are thoroughly dry before putting them back in the tin storage container. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Good Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great for biscuits
customer_reviews.text: These work great for biscuits. I also use them for eggs-in-a-basket. They slice through a piece of soft white bread cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia K Easterling

customer_reviews.title: Decent Circular Cutters
customer_reviews.text: These things are decently made. Not a huge fan of the seam however. Also, they are not non-stick so if you're using them for eggs or anything that sticks, you're going to have a bad time.
customer_reviews.author: GBeezi

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy cooking with them;) This is a high quality product and durable material are used...Easy to clean... Affordable price for such a quality, so this is just amazing cutters. love it;)...
customer_reviews.author: BORIS

customer_reviews.title: Great cutters
customer_reviews.text: I really like these cutters and the large sizes work well for hand pie circles.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I bought some from the store and these are much nicer! Great sizes!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle King

customer_reviews.title: but I've used them for other things like apple rings and such
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought this set for cutting out donuts, but I've used them for other things like apple rings and such. The set is nice and hefty and I have yet to see any rust of damage to any of the rings. A good amount of this comes from the included case/holding tin. My only gripe is that the sizes aren't engraved on the rigs.
customer_reviews.author: James Sadler

customer_reviews.title: great biscuit cutters
customer_reviews.text: These biscuit cutters are great and 2 sides so you can get a pattern for cookies and a perfect circle for biscuits. I have had no issues and they arrived nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Kayle

customer_reviews.title: nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I use them for poly clay and they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda

customer_reviews.title: You need these if you decorate cakes
customer_reviews.text: If you decorate cakes at all, you need this set. I use it with literally every cake I decorate. Previously, I was constantly searching for something to make the size circle or half-circle I needed. Now they are right at my fingertips. Until I got them, I didn't realize just how much I would use them. They are still sharp and haven't rusted at all, so I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Fremont

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't have the exact size of biscuit I like to make ...
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't have the exact size of biscuit I like to make but that is probably because it came from a plastic cup that I have used for five years before actually buying cutters. They are really good quality and haven't rusted. I make sure they dry fairly soon after washing. They seem to be high quality and cut very well. No wobble in the metal or anything when I cut.
customer_reviews.author: S. D.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mom. She loves them works great, good size, easy to clean and use
customer_reviews.author: Joe Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Muffin mania
customer_reviews.text: If you want to make muffins you need some good muffin cutters. These work well.
customer_reviews.author: Biogyro

customer_reviews.title: Works but do I really need these large ones.
customer_reviews.text: Well made but storage space in my kitchen is tight. I only use the second to smallest for biscuits, so I should have just bought 1 size.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny K

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these cutters all of one time and I already love them. With all of the size options there is no problem getting the right sized circle I need. The reinforced top (rounded edge) is nice and I really don't feel as those these cutters are flimsy like some are. The tin is great for storing them also, I can't think of something I want LESS than all these cutters randomly rolling around in a bin somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda R

customer_reviews.title: I bought these thinking they were cookie cutters but I ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these thinking they were cookie cutters but I planned on using them to make eggs for breakfast sandwiches. They're actually biscuit cutters so they're really deep.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Fortman

customer_reviews.title: Clean Cut!
customer_reviews.text: Clean cut! I love these multisize circle cutters. Currently I am using them for making mosaic floor tile and round Christmas ornaments from ceramic porcelain clay. They cut cleanly. My husband made me "pushers" using hole saws to get the clay circles cleanly out of the cutters. They clean up quick and do not rust.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen B

customer_reviews.title: works well, be careful with the upper edge
customer_reviews.text: Good value, quality. Use a bowl/plate/board if you need to press down hard; this keeps the top sharp edge from cutting into your fingers, and keeps the ring square. All around nice item.
customer_reviews.author: J. Melanson

customer_reviews.title: Good for cooking or clay work
customer_reviews.text: These are good metal, well cut and formed so they are exactly round. The size range is awesome form about an inch across to maybe four inches more or less. They nest in the can to store compactly and neatly. The cutting edges are smooth and sharp enough to do any dough or clay you're working with. Nice polished surfaces. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pelland

customer_reviews.title: Greay
customer_reviews.text: Works well easy to use easy to clean and store great buy
customer_reviews.author: amber sawmiller

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, clean, and store. Many sizes and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Albert W. Herr

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: They are awesome!! And fast were you seeing with quinoa and measurements
customer_reviews.author: Ryan R.

customer_reviews.title: My life is complete.
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought these for my birthday. I know, it's not diamonds. But my love language is baking so this was really exciting to crack open. I haven't been too rough with them so I can't say that they're indestructible but seriously - how rough are you planning on bring with a cutter set? So, anyways. Life is complete. I've made cookies and biscuits and have lots of diabolical plans for these babies.
customer_reviews.author: MrsBrown

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: They come in a wonderful tin to keep them together. The seams are connected better than they used to be which means less chance of rusting which is a huge plus. There isn't much to say about round cutters. The lip on the top makes for pain free pressing for continued use. I recommend this set to anyone who does a lot of rolled cookies, marzipan/fondant flowers, biscuits and the like.
customer_reviews.author: frangipanetarts

customer_reviews.title: Great for cutting and dough and such.
customer_reviews.text: I use these in my culinary classes for cutting dough and making cookies etc. It is a great tool to have for any kitchen means and you can't beat the price for this set. I have seen other brands but they didn't have the rolled edge on one side which makes it easier to press down on. A must have kitchen item.
customer_reviews.author: Master Woo

customer_reviews.title: these are supper cool they shipped fast and have there own little contaner ...
customer_reviews.text: these are supper cool they shipped fast and have there own little contaner too store them in ,,, i would have gave them a 5 star but u do need to be a little careful when using them the set i have the metal isnt even so when cutting it stabs what ever u cut on .. ie i use my baking mat because i dont stick to the counter but these mark into it . but there are tones of sizes and if u are careful when u use it you will be fine .
customer_reviews.author: Rabecka

customer_reviews.title: Love is Simple
customer_reviews.text: And these are simply lovable. The compact, nesting storage design (one which I practically insist on for graduated cutters of any shape) makes 11 (eleven!) rings fit in the space of one, covered and kept together, and short of needing to cut a full-sized pizza crust out of a sheet of dough, there's a size for every baking and serving and decorating need. A brilliant, quality product.
customer_reviews.author: CAS MARINO

customer_reviews.title: Ateco 6-Piece Double Sided Round Cutter Set
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this product cannot be beat. I have already used it to cut out biscuits, but I also plan to use it for doughnuts, ravioli, and bread rolls. In the past, I had used jars, glasses, empty cans, and pizza cutters, but this is much better. I get the size I want.
customer_reviews.author: JP Georgia

customer_reviews.title: A very complete set of circle cutters
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use with my polymer clay but I think instead I will use them for what they were intended... cookies!! They are a wonderful complete set sized set of circles. They are really well made and I can think of a lot of cookies I can use them on!!! I think making cookies for an afternoon tea with my friends would be a great way to break them in!!!
customer_reviews.author: B.C.

customer_reviews.title: The two greatest features bar none
customer_reviews.text: Bought these around the holidays last year to cut out empanada dough. The two greatest features bar none: these are dishwasher safe and are self enclosed with a lid. I know it is not clear from the picture, but it does come with a lid. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: Shady A.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little baking rings!!!
customer_reviews.text: I picked these up for school and use them a lot. If you need round cutters, these rock!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Simple but functional
customer_reviews.text: I use these all the time to form nicely rounded hamburger patties.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Hill

customer_reviews.title: Cutters
customer_reviews.text: These cutters will do the job for you if you need cutters for cookies or other dough. They seem to be well made and having the tin to store them in is a great bonus. They are sharp enough without being so sharp that you would cut yourself on them and rigid enough to handle the job. It was so nice to throw away my old tuna can that I had used as a cutter for too long.
customer_reviews.author: RDSWY4

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Sizes are awkward and they are flimsy. I threw them away and spent more for a better set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awkward two sided
customer_reviews.text: I regret purchasing the two sided option because its a little awkward pressing down on the fluted edge. It might be easier to use a potholder instead of your hand to cut items.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient- many good quality cutters in a tiny package!
customer_reviews.text: Love these. They are compact and store with my Kitchenaid accessories. I have any size I need right at my fingertips. I wish they were easier to get out, as I have to pull several out to get the one I need, but that is a minor thing. Having them all together in one tin, no storage issue is much more important!
customer_reviews.author: E.Rigby

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Great for making the perfect round egg on my English muffin.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: The KING of cutters!
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered these to use while making melt and pour soaps. I use them to make circles and all sorts of fun little embeds to toss in my soap loaves. They hold up so well, haven't rusted or even bent in the slightest bit. They're very easy to store, don't take up much room, and are really durable. These cutters are so amazing, I'll probably order a whole other set for baking too!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Harris

customer_reviews.title: I didn't realize there were overlap seams (most are smooth ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize there were overlap seams (most are smooth, seamlessly welded rings). It hasn't affected my foods but if you're doing something that requires perfectly smooth edges, this isn't your set.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas R.

customer_reviews.title: Well made, needs some type of size marking
customer_reviews.text: These are well made and easy to use. My only complaint is the lack of a marking so I can note in a recipe which cutter I used last. Labeling them #1 through #11 or the actual diameter would be very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: J. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy
customer_reviews.text: Little pricey but an excellent product. very Happy - Add a storage tin and this item would be perfect!
customer_reviews.author: L. Eldred-Lotto

customer_reviews.title: Great cutters!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size biscuit/cookie cutters. They are very slim, and easily bendable. I used these to cut out mini tea cakes and they worked great. We’re the perfect height and diameter for project.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Circular multitasker.
customer_reviews.text: Metal. Round. Cuts soft stuff like dough, cookies, fudge, elegant sandwiches, and that homemade organic soap you'll probably make one time, if ever. Dishwasher safe. Haven't rusted yet. Can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: G. Mellott

customer_reviews.title: Nice set
customer_reviews.text: Nice biscuit/ cookie cutters. Work well. Slightly thin metal, but not an issue for use.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy

customer_reviews.title: I like the little box for storing also
customer_reviews.text: These are exactly as pictured. I gave them a 4 because they are a bit flimsy but I feel for the price I got a lot for my money as far as the number of rings. I like the little box for storing also. Easy in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Grammie B

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I use these all the time for different things: cookies, sugarpaste, crafts (I can't draw a circle), helping get my wonky cupcake liners back into shape! They are well made and very sturdy! Love them!
customer_reviews.author: LisaMH

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: They're just what they say they are. Works great for me!
customer_reviews.author: DCMC84

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about metal circles. Quality is good. I expect them to last forever.
customer_reviews.author: eatongee

customer_reviews.title: The set brings different sizes.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to cut the dough with these cutters. They don't stick and cut so well. I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Evans

customer_reviews.title: Bent
customer_reviews.text: I just got these today an they are bent what away to sent something to a customer not very happy
customer_reviews.author: Jacobland

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and deforms easily.
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy at best. Bends even if you look at it funny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: These work great. I use them for almost everything. Work great on cake sheets!
customer_reviews.author: bprieto

customer_reviews.title: Savvy Shopper
customer_reviews.text: Very well made - despite the ubiquitous "Made in China" - these 11 crinkle cutters (from 3/4" to 3-1/4") all have nicely rounded tops which are very easy on the palms as you use them repeatedly. BUT - the best feature is the little can, in which they are all stored neatly, concentrically. Why not 5 stars? - I would have preferred larger crinkles (especially for the larger sizes).
customer_reviews.author: Maritimer

customer_reviews.title: OMG, use these every day not only for biscuits ...
customer_reviews.text: OMG, use these every day not only for biscuits or cookies but for portion control and decorative platters. I make quiche and salads, crab cake towers etc. I will soon need a new set!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: These cutters are very flimsy. They look like they will rust quickly. I returned item and had to pay shipping. I am going to buy a sturdy nylon cutter set instead.
customer_reviews.author: James Facio

customer_reviews.title: making it easier to find the perfect size.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to accompany a set I already had, making it easier to find the perfect size.
customer_reviews.author: Frances Gill

customer_reviews.title: Great Pastry Cutters
customer_reviews.text: Nice little set. Doesn't take up a lot of room as all the cutters nest in a small can. Love these for making layered cookies. Makes it a lot easier to cut out the different sizes when needed. Easy to clean and are fairly sturdy. The can itself is 4 inches in diameter and is 1 and 1/4 inch thick.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Old Coot

product_meta.title: Ateco Double Sided Large Round Cutters in Graduated Sizes, Fluted & Plain Edges, Stainless Steel, 6 Pc Set
product_meta.description: Size:Fluted & Plain Edges - Double Sided| Style:Round - 2" - 4"Each cutter in this Double Sided Round Cutter Set has a fluted side and a plain side. Cutters range in diameter from 2 inch - 4.5 inch. 6-piece set. Made of stainless steel. By Ateco. Since 1905, Ateco has supplied fine restaurants and bakeries with quality built, specialty baking tools. Ateco products are internationally renowned for their high quality. When you use Ateco products, you’re not only enjoying quality craftsmanship, you’re also enjoying quality design; the products are a result of over one hundred years and four generations of innovation and development.
feature_bullets: Each cutter has a fluted side and a plain side
Cutters range in diameter from 2 inch - 4.5 inch
Constructed of quality, long lasting stainless steel
By Ateco – professional quality and quality design
